mainInfo.important: Prices are in US dollars, per person, based on double occupancy. Prices are subject to change without notice by cruise lines until a deposit has been made, and must be reconfirmed at time of booking. Prices include port charges but do not include airfare or (where applicable) airport or government taxes or fees. Prices and promotions are for new bookings only, in accordance with cruise line policies. Click any price to convert to other currencies.

ship.name: MSC Seaside
ship.description:
The MSC Seaside is the first ship in the MSC fleet to be christened in the United States. This new generation of cruise ship boasts revolutionary architecture and cutting-edge technology that is sure to suit all passengers who come aboard. The ship is designed for the warm weather of the Caribbean and as such, offers a unique wrap-around waterfront promenade. Along the promenade, guests will find various places to shop and eat, as well as sunbathing locations that provide beautiful panoramic sea views. The MSC Seaside has connecting inside and outside public areas throughout its decks, and passengers will find the private accommodations to be elegant and luxurious.
The ship also offers an Aquapark that is one of the largest and most interactive found at sea. The MSC Seaside is the first cruise ship to feature Slideboarding technology, as well. This technology combines a slide with an interactive game and provides lasting fun for the whole family. Additionally, members of the MSC Yacht Club will discover a place to indulge in secluded luxury while still participating in all of the recreation and entertainment that the rest of the ship has to offer.
ship.raw:
MSC Seaside

The MSC Seaside is the first ship in the MSC fleet to be christened in the United States. This new generation of cruise ship boasts revolutionary architecture and cutting-edge technology that is sure to suit all passengers who come aboard. The ship is designed for the warm weather of the Caribbean and as such, offers a unique wrap-around waterfront promenade. Along the promenade, guests will find various places to shop and eat, as well as sunbathing locations that provide beautiful panoramic sea views. The MSC Seaside has connecting inside and outside public areas throughout its decks, and passengers will find the private accommodations to be elegant and luxurious.

The ship also offers an Aquapark that is one of the largest and most interactive found at sea. The MSC Seaside is the first cruise ship to feature Slideboarding technology, as well. This technology combines a slide with an interactive game and provides lasting fun for the whole family. Additionally, members of the MSC Yacht Club will discover a place to indulge in secluded luxury while still participating in all of the recreation and entertainment that the rest of the ship has to offer.

Ship Statistics
Year Built 2017
Tonnage 160,000 tons
Registry Panama
Length 1,060 feet
Beam 135 feet
Passenger Capacity 5,429
Crew Size 1,413
# of Inside Cabins 460
# of Outside Cabins 1,607
# of Cabins w/ Verandas 1519
# of Suites 216
Max. Room Occupancy 10
Age Restrictions
One person must be 21 or older
Dining Options click here
Tipping Expected? Yes
Tipping Guidelines
MSC Cruises will automatically add $10.00-$14.50 per day, per guest to your onboard account (depending on the region of the cruise). These amounts cannot be adjusted onboard. A 15% tip is added to all beverage orders. The service charge for children between the ages of 2 and 11 will be 50% less than adult fees, and no charge is added for children under the age of 2.
Onboard Currency US Dollar

cabin.raw:
Category YC3 (MSC Yacht Club Royal Suite)
Comfortable king bed. Balcony with a private whirlpool bath and dining table. Separate living area and dining room. Spacious closet. Bathroom with shower and bathtub, vanity area and hairdryer. Interactive TV, telephone, safe and minibar. Complimentary Wi-Fi. Approx. 667 ft2 with a balcony that is approx. 355 ft2. Discover a world of privileges with MSC Yacht Club.

ports.raw:
Port Canaveral, FL
Cruises from Port Canaveral depart year-round.

Port Canaveral, FL is about an hour's drive east of Orlando, two hours from Tampa and two and a half hours from Jacksonville. Tallahassee is just under five hours to the north. Port Canaveral is the closest city to Disney World and the other theme parks in Orlando, and is next to Cape Canaveral Kennedy Space Center. A wide variety of activities are available near the port, including several miles of beaches and parks, boating, fishing, shopping and several restaurants.

More info
ports.info: Port Canaveral, FL is about an hour's drive east of Orlando, two hours from Tampa and two and a half hours from Jacksonville. Tallahassee is just under five hours to the north. Port Canaveral is the closest city to Disney World and the other theme parks in Orlando, and is next to Cape Canaveral Kennedy Space Center. A wide variety of activities are available near the port, including several miles of beaches and parks, boating, fishing, shopping and several restaurants.
ports.caption: Cruises from Port Canaveral depart year-round.

ports.raw:
Ocean Cay Marine Reserve, Bahamas
Located 20 miles south of Bimini, the Ocean Cay MSC Marine Reserve is an exclusive getaway that provides some of the finest beaches in the world and offers a variety of Caribbean-inspired experiences. The island is 95-acres of pristine beach front and Marine Reserve land full of distinguishing Caribbean features like a Bahamian village, Jamaica Dogwood trees, Mangroves, Beach Morning Glory, and various other plants around the island. A seafront pier allows passengers to step off the ship and right onto the island. Ocean Cay Marine Reserve boasts a unique night life with live music and entertainment found in large amphitheatre. There are also many restaurants and bars that guests... More info
ports.caption: Located 20 miles south of Bimini, the Ocean Cay MSC Marine Reserve is an exclusive getaway that provides some of the finest beaches in the world and offers a variety of Caribbean-inspired experiences. The island is 95-acres of pristine beach front and Marine Reserve land full of distinguishing Caribbean features like a Bahamian village, Jamaica Dogwood trees, Mangroves, Beach Morning Glory, and various other plants around the island. A seafront pier allows passengers to step off the ship and right onto the island. Ocean Cay Marine Reserve boasts a unique night life with live music and entertainment found in large amphitheatre. There are also many restaurants and bars that guests...

ports.raw:
St. Maarten
Christopher Columbus' sighting first brought European attention to this island in 1493. Today, St. Maarten flies two flags, making the island part-French and part-Dutch. Cruise ships more commonly call on the Dutch side of St. Maarten, known for its year-round sunshine, slew of shopping centers and buzzing nightlife. Visitors can voyage the Caribbean aboard a catamaran, kayak or Jet Ski. Island outings include all-terrain vehicle adventures, culinary tours and snorkeling or scuba diving trips. Walking and biking tours explore the historic capital, Philipsburg, and luxury yachts and sailboats offer private charters for enhanced relaxation. More info
ports.caption: Christopher Columbus' sighting first brought European attention to this island in 1493. Today, St. Maarten flies two flags, making the island part-French and part-Dutch. Cruise ships more commonly call on the Dutch side of St. Maarten, known for its year-round sunshine, slew of shopping centers and buzzing nightlife. Visitors can voyage the Caribbean aboard a catamaran, kayak or Jet Ski. Island outings include all-terrain vehicle adventures, culinary tours and snorkeling or scuba diving trips. Walking and biking tours explore the historic capital, Philipsburg, and luxury yachts and sailboats offer private charters for enhanced relaxation.

ports.raw:
Antigua
Part of the eastern Caribbean's Leeward Islands, Antigua was discovered and named by Christopher Columbus in 1493. The sun-soaked isle is small at just 108 square miles, but it boasts 365 beaches and crystal-clear water. History buffs will want to tour Nelson's Dockyard National Park, where one of the great admirals of the 18th century kept his fleet. The UNESCO World Heritage Site has been continuously in operation since 1745 and displays a telescope once used by Nelson himself. Other visitors might opt to lounge on one of the white-sand beaches, partake in water sports or go for a horseback ride along the shore. Hike up to Shirley Heights, a... More info
ports.caption: Part of the eastern Caribbean's Leeward Islands, Antigua was discovered and named by Christopher Columbus in 1493. The sun-soaked isle is small at just 108 square miles, but it boasts 365 beaches and crystal-clear water. History buffs will want to tour Nelson's Dockyard National Park, where one of the great admirals of the 18th century kept his fleet. The UNESCO World Heritage Site has been continuously in operation since 1745 and displays a telescope once used by Nelson himself. Other visitors might opt to lounge on one of the white-sand beaches, partake in water sports or go for a horseback ride along the shore. Hike up to Shirley Heights, a...

ports.raw:
Fort-de-France, Martinique
Mountainous Martinique is one of the most scenic and colorful islands in the Caribbean. Acres of lush tropical vegetation and an abundance of flowers vie with vast green stretches of banana plantations, pineapple and sugarcane fields. With 425 square miles, Martinique is the largest of the Windward Islands. Boasting a combination of stunning scenery and French-Caribbean ambiance, one can easily see why it appeals to a wide spectrum of visitors. More info
ports.caption: Mountainous Martinique is one of the most scenic and colorful islands in the Caribbean. Acres of lush tropical vegetation and an abundance of flowers vie with vast green stretches of banana plantations, pineapple and sugarcane fields. With 425 square miles, Martinique is the largest of the Windward Islands. Boasting a combination of stunning scenery and French-Caribbean ambiance, one can easily see why it appeals to a wide spectrum of visitors.
